name: Split Pea Soup
description: A hearty, comforting soup made with split peas and ham hock, cooked until the peas dissolve into a creamy texture.
instructions: Fill a soup pot (tall pot like a spaghetti pot) with water leaving one inch at the top
Put onions and ham hock into water, bring to a boil and let cook 1-2 hours (until meat is tender and falling off the bone) - do not drain water.
Remove/discard bones and fat and cut meat up into smaller piece
-Put meat, carrots and peas into water (reserved water with onions) and cook until all peas have dissolved
Season with salt and pepper to taste
